intro: Leandra urbaniana, commonly known as the urbaniana tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
